<JD_START>
Job Title: Associate Buyer

Location: Texas, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
Job Description

 Job Summary 

Associate Buyers are responsible for a select part of the Buyer’s overall business and must drive the merchandise strategy and assortments for this part of the business with the goal of meeting or exceeding sales, margin and turn targets. An Associate Buyer, with support from the Buyer, is responsible for the purchase and negotiation of merchandise for their business areas. Associate Buyers partner with Planners and Sourcing Managers to develop strategies to maximize business opportunities and manage the open-to-buy and analyze business trends.

Key Roles And Responsibilities

 Develop and execute merchandise strategies and assortment plans in partnership with Buyer/ Sr. Buyer, Planner and Sourcing Manger, based on customer preferences, to deliver financial goals and business objectives  React quickly and decisively to business opportunities to achieve and consistently maintain positive comp sales growth and increased comp margin  Partners with Buyer/ Sr. Buyer and Planner on development of merchandise financial plans and by-door assortment strategy by providing regular and timely input  Effectively manage inventory and identify risks in assortment in partnership with Buyer and Planner  Build and maintain strong partnerships with product partners  In partnership with Buyer/ Sr. Buyer, responsible for product development and selection of merchandise supporting department strategy  Partner with direct sourcing on achieving margin improvement opportunities & negotiation of best costs  Optimize product partner matrix in partnership with direct sourcing  Identify business opportunities and risks in-season through analyzing sales performance and gathering marketplace information in partnership with Buyer and Planner; Implement strategies to ensure plans are achieved  Partner with Buyer/ Sr. Buyer and Planner on open-to-buy process to manage business in-season and maximize opportunities  Review markdown candidates and make suggestions on additions/deletions in partnership with Buyer/ Sr. Buyer and Planner  Ensures deadlines and processes within the buying office are followed to meet company deadlines and timelines  Travel to all necessary markets and identify product opportunities  Supports initiatives to develop and maintain best practices to constantly improve efficacy and efficiency of the merchandising organization  Leads development and implementation of reinventions, visual initiatives, EDLP + and collaborations including coordination with cross – functional partners  Partner with Marketing and Digital to achieve strategic business objectives 

Qualifications And Competencies

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required  3-5 years of retail buying, planning or related experience  Possesses strong merchandising, product and marketing skills  Demonstrate strong analytical, negotiating and problem-solving skills  Ability develop/maintain strong working relationship with peers and cross-functional teams  Demonstrates leadership and decision-making skills  Demonstrates strong listening, written and oral communication skills  Willing and able to travel for market and store trips  Flexible and adaptive to changing priorities  Possesses a clear understanding of the supply chain: product development, sourcing, packaging and shipping  Able to organize and prioritize workload to meet deadline  Takes calculated risks to achieve results  Develops creative solutions to business issues  Identifies emerging trends and shops competition and market regularly 

 Type  : Exempt

When you’re a part of our team, you have the full support of a diverse, close-knit team in our stores. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law. At Home is committed to knitting diversity and inclusion into the fabric of our culture; we respect, appreciate, and celebrate the experiences and qualities that differentiate everyone on the At Home team.
